Key Match Events: Kevin Gausman pitched five no-hit innings before exiting with lower back tightness.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit two solo homers.
Toronto Blue Jays beat the Texas Rangers 4-0.
Texas managed only two singles against Gausman and four relievers.
Dillon Tate struck out two of the three batters he faced in a perfect sixth inning.
Génesis Cabrera took over in the seventh inning.
Josh Smith lined the first pitch sharply into right-center for a hit but was thrown out trying to stretch it for a double.
Rangers rookie Kumar Rocker struck out five, walked four, and hit a batter over three innings in his second career start.
Post-Match Reflections: Kevin Gausman expressed surprise at not giving up hits despite feeling physically bad.
John Schneider commented on Gausman's performance and decision to exit the game.
Bruce Bochy praised Kumar Rocker's maturity and ability to limit damage despite command issues.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Blue Jays recorded their ninth shutout victory of the season.
The Rangers were held scoreless for the 10th time this season.
Bo Bichette was put on the injured list with a broken right middle finger.
